meanings.definition: More like an aunt in behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: She wore an auntlier dress to the family gathering.
meanings.sent2: The kind smile on her face made her look auntlier than usual.
meanings.sent3: Her auntlier wave goodbye made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The cozy living room felt auntlier with the addition of family photos.
meanings.sent5: The auntlier tone in her voice reminded him of his favorite relative.

meanings.sent1: She spoke auntlier to the children, using gentle words.
meanings.sent2: The little girl imitated her auntlier, walking with grace.
meanings.sent3: He comically tried to cook auntlier, but ended up burning the toast.
meanings.sent4: The music played auntlier as the family danced together.
meanings.sent5: The flowers in the garden bloomed auntlier after the rain.
